intro: Veronica macrostachya subsp. iconiensis, commonly known as the Icon Island veronica, is a flowering plant native to the island of Iconia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces spikes of blue to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is appreciated in horticulture for its vibrant blooms.
